org.vertx.java.core

Class VertxFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vertx.java.core.VertxFactory

  • public abstract class VertxFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory for creating Vertx instances.

    Use this to create Vertx instances when embedding Vert.x core directly.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VertxFactory() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      protected Vertx createVertx(int port, java.lang.String hostname)

      protected Vertx createVertx(java.lang.String hostname) 
      static Vertx newVertx()
      Create a non clustered Vertx instance
      static Vertx newVertx(int port, java.lang.String hostname)
      Create a clustered Vertx instance.
      static void newVertx(int port, java.lang.String hostname, Handler<AsyncResult<Vertx>> resultHandler)
      Create a clustered Vertx instance returning the instance asynchronously in the resultHandler when the event bus is ready and listening
      static Vertx newVertx(java.lang.String hostname)
      Create a clustered Vertx instance listening for cluster connections on the default port 25500

      • newVertx

        public static Vertx newVertx(java.lang.String hostname)
        Create a clustered Vertx instance listening for cluster connections on the default port 25500
        Parameters:
        hostname - The hostname or ip address to listen for cluster connections

      • newVertx

        public static Vertx newVertx(int port,
                             java.lang.String hostname)
        Create a clustered Vertx instance. Note that the event bus might not be listening until some time after this method has returned
        Parameters:
        port - The port to listen for cluster connections
        hostname - The hostname or ip address to listen for cluster connections

      • newVertx

        public static void newVertx(int port,
                            java.lang.String hostname,
                            Handler<AsyncResult<Vertx>> resultHandler)
        Create a clustered Vertx instance returning the instance asynchronously in the resultHandler when the event bus is ready and listening
        Parameters:
        port - The port to listen for cluster connections
        hostname - The hostname or ip address to listen for cluster connections
